software_update_start_confirm: Are you sure you want to update the software?
software_update_copyProgress: Software update file upload in progress.
software_update_noResponse: No response recieved. Software update status unknown.
software_update_restart_message: Please restart the switch for booting up with the updated software
software_update_relaunch: Please reload the page to load the updated Web UI.
software_update_restart_confirm: Are you sure you want to restart the switch? You will lose connectivity while the switch restarts.
restart_confirm: Are you sure you want to restart the switch?
restart_success: Successfully submitted the request to restart the switch.
software_update_restart_success: Successfully restarted the switch. Please wait for sometime before you re-open the Web UI.
day0_wizard_success_msg: Configuration successful. Please access WebUI using the configured Management IP Address.
day0_wizard_fail_msg: Day0 Wizard Configuration failed to apply.
help_ports_speed: To allow communicating ports to decide the optimum speed for transmission, choose auto. Otherwise choose one of the following speed options: 10MB, 100MB, or 1000MB
help_ports_duplex: Auto auto-negotiates the interface mode, and allows communicating ports to decide the optimum mode for data transmission.Half-duplex communication is unidirectional, and the device cannot send and receive data simultaneously. This option can impact the performance of your device. Full-duplex communication increases effective bandwidth by allowing both ends of a connection to transmit and receive data simultaneously.
help_ports_status: Set to Up, to enable the interface.
help_ports_switch_mode: Access ports transport traffic to and from only the VLAN assigned to it. If you choose access mode, assign a VLAN to the port. All ports assigned to  VLAN 1 are assigned as access ports. Trunk ports carry traffic for multiple VLANs, using a process called trunking. Trunk ports mark frames with unique identifying IEEE 802.1Q tags (when configured), to direct each frame to its designated VLAN. If you choose trunk as the switch mode, assign a range of VLANs to the port. When a port is in dynamic auto mode, it passively listens for and receives Dynamic Trunking Protocol (DTP) messages generated by a port in dynamic desirable mode, on another switch on the other side. A trunk link is formed between the two interfaces and all frames are tagged. If you choose dynamic auto or dynamic desirable, assign a range of VLANs to the port.
help_ports_native_VLAN: When your device receives untagged frames on a trunk port, they are sent to the native VLAN. By default, this is VLAN 1. For network security reasons,  specify a different VLAN as your native VLAN
help_ports_PortFast: If your device connects to endpoints (for example, to phones and  computers and not to other switches or hubs), select to enable PortFast on the interface. Devices that connect to PortFast enabled ports can connect to the network immediately, instead of waiting for the port to transition from the listening and learning states to the forwarding state.
help_ports_DHCP_snooping: Enable to activate DHCP snooping on the port. DHCP snooping acts like a firewall between untrusted hosts and trusted DHCP servers, validating DHCP messages received from untrusted sources and filtering out invalid messages. The DHCP snooping binding database maintains information about untrusted hosts with leased IP addresses, and validates subsequent requests from untrusted hosts.
help_ports_storm_control: Storm control prevents traffic on a LAN from being disrupted by a broadcast, multicast, or unicast storm on a port. Choose Shutdown to error-disable the port during a storm and choose Trap to generate an SNMP trap when a storm is detected. To disable storm control, choose None. Set the storm control threshold for your broadcast, multicast, and unicast traffic. A higher threshold allows more packets to pass through.
help_SNMP_status: SNMP Status Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) enables the exchange of management information between the management server and network devices. Using SNMP, you can monitor network performance, audit network usage, detect network faults.
help_SNMP_global_trap: Enables traps globally. An SNMP Trap is an immediate notification sent from your device for an event that might otherwise be discovered only during SNMP polling. Traps might indicate power-up or link-up/down conditions, temperatures exceeding certain thresholds, or high traffic.
help_SNMP_global_tftp: Limiting TFTP servers used via SNMP . Enter either IP standard access list value 1-99 or Access-list name
help_SNMP_user_tftp: Std IP accesslist allowing access with this username
help_SNMP_community_name: A community name acts as a password that is shared, typically, by multiple SNMP agents and one or more SNMP servers. Enter a name for the community for which you want to set access permissions. The name must be a unique, case-sensitive, alphanumeric string of up to 16 characters.
help_SNMP_access_mode: By default, this is Read-only. Change to Read-write mode to support SNMP SetRequests. Read-only mode supports only SNMP GetRequests, and GetNextRequests.
help_SNMP_group: Enter a group name for the profile. An SNMP group is an access control policy to which users can be added. Each SNMP group is configured with a security model. A user within an SNMP group should match the security model of the SNMP group. These parameters specify what type of authentication and privacy a user within an SNMP group uses. Each SNMP group name and security model pair must be unique.
help_SNMP_auth_protocol: Choose an algorithm to configure authentication based on the Hashed Message Authentication Code (HMAC)-MD5 or HMAC-SHA algorithms. Enter a passkey to authenticate user access. Auth Protocol corresponds to the AuthNoPriv security model.
help_SNMP_priv_protocol: To configure Advanced Encryption Standard (AES) or Data Encryption Standard (DES) encryption, choose a Priv Protocol encyption method. AES 128, AES 192, and AES 256 use Cipher Feedback (CFB) mode with encryption key sizes of 128, 192, or 256 bits respectively. 3DES uses the Cipher Block Chaining (CBC)-DES (DES-56) standard with a 168-bit key size for encryption. Priv Protocol corresponds to the AuthPriv security model.
help_SNMP_IP_address: Enter the IP address from which this device accepts and sends SNMP packets.
help_SNMP_port: Enter the UDP port number for the remote SNMP agent of the device where the user resides.
help_SNMP_version: SNMP Version 1, Version 2C, and Version 3 are supported on your device.
help_SNMP_type: Specify if the message is a trap or a notification.
help_time_set_offset_hours: Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) is the 24-hour time standard and the basis for civil time today. Based on the timezone you selected, enter the number of hours by which you want it offset on your device, to arrive at your local time.
help_VLAN_ID: Enter an ID between 2 and 4094, to identify the VLAN on your network. A VLAN logically groups devices that are located on different LANs and allows them to communicate as if they are physically connected. Creating VLANs lets you divide your network into different logical broadcast domains, and optimize your networkâ€™s bandwidth usage and security. For example, you can use VLANs to separate voice and data traffic.
help_VLAN_State: Set the state to active to forward traffic through the VLAN. VLANs in suspended state will not forward traffic.
help_VLAN_group_name: Create a VLAN group as a logical container for your VLANs. A VLAN group allows you to apply a set of common parameters to all the VLANs in the group.
help_VLAN_list: Enter the range of VLANs, from 2 to 4094, you want to include in the VLAN group. The recommended number of VLANs in a group is 32.
help_VLAN_IP_DHCP_snooping: Set to enable, to activate DHCP snooping on a VLAN or a range of VLANs. DHCP snooping acts like a firewall between untrusted hosts and trusted DHCP servers, validating DHCP messages received from untrusted sources and filtering out invalid messages. The DHCP snooping binding database maintains information about untrusted hosts with leased IP addresses, and validates subsequent requests from untrusted hosts.
help_VLAN_list_default: Enter the range of VLANs, from 2 to 4094, you want to include in the VLAN group. The recommended number of VLANs in a group is 32. VLAN 1 is created by default, and cannot be deleted.
help_day0_hostname:
The Day 0 wizard allows you to quickly set up your device with the minimum configuration required to enable traffic to pass through the network. 
Enter a hostname to identify your device on the network. The hostname can be alphanumeric, case sensitive, can contain special characters, and can have a maximum of 32 characters.
help_day0_username: Enter a username that is unique and between 1 and 25 characters long.
help_day0_password: Enter a password that is between 8 and 127 characters long. It is recommended that the password is a combination of at least three of the following categories: lowercase letters, uppercase letters, digits, and special characters. The new password should not be the same as the associated username or any close variant of the username. The characters in the password should not be repeated more than three times consecutively. The password should not be cisco, ocsic, admin, nimda, or any variant of the order of letters, or by substituting '1' '|' or '!' for i, and/or substituting '0' for 'o', and/or substituting '$' for 's'.
help_day0_clock: Set the device time and date.
help_day0_data_VLAN: Enter the VLAN on which to carry IP data traffic. All ports, by default, are associated with data VLAN 1. Separating voice and data traffic creates a security boundary preventing data applications from accessing voice traffic.
help_day0_voice_VLAN: Enter the VLAN on which to carry IP voice traffic.
help_day0_access_ports: Hold the CTRL key down to select multiple access ports. An access port carries traffic for the VLAN configured on the interface. If a VLAN is not configured for the access port, the interface carries traffic on the default VLAN.
help_day0_portfast_enable: Select to enable PortFast on all the specified access ports. Devices that connect to PortFast enabled ports can connect to the network immediately, instead of waiting for the port to transition from the listening and learning states to the forwarding state.
help_day0_uplink_port: The uplink port functions as a trunk port connecting to a switch or router. A trunk port carries traffic for all the VLANs that are accessible by a specific device. Trunk ports mark traffic with unique identifying tags (802.1Q tags, when configured) , to ensure that traffic is accurately directed to its designated VLAN.
help_day0_default_gateway: Enter the IP address of the default gateway. A default gateway allows endpoints and devices on your network to communicate with endpoints other networks.
help_day0_default_route: The IP address and subnet mask of the default next hop router. A default route specifies a path the device should use if it does not know how to reach the destination.
help_day0_IP_address_assignment: Assign an IP to the interface. You can configure multiple interfaces based on the license level associated with the device.
help_day0_enable_telnet: Select this to enable access to the device using Telnet. Configure a username and password to authenticate user access to the device.
help_day0_enable_SSH: Select this to enable secure remote access to the device using Secure Shell (SSH). Configure a username and password to authenticate user access to the device.
help_day0_enable_SSH_domain: Enter a domain name for the device.
help_day0_enable_SSH_rsa_key: Enter  the generated  Rivest, Shamir, and Adelman (RSA) key for the device. The recommended minimum RSA key size is 1024.
help_day0_auto_QoS_for_cisco_phones: Select this to enable Auto-QoS on access ports connected to Cisco IP phones.
help_day0_auto_QoS_for_uplinks: Select this to enable Auto-QoS on uplink ports connecting to a trusted switch or router.
help_switch_hostname: Enter a hostname to identify your device on the network. The hostname can be alphanumeric, is case sensitive, can contain special characters, and can have a maximum of 32 characters. Switch IP address: To be able to manage the switch remotely, assign an IP address to it.
help_switch_management_VLAN: The management VLAN is the VLAN that contains the interface that is used to remotely manage the switch. By default, this is VLAN 1, as all ports are assigned to VLAN 1. We recommend that you not use VLAN 1 or VLANs that are used by client devices such as users and printers.
help_switch_MTU_size: The maximum transmission unit is the largest sized packet that your device can send. If the connected router cannot handle a large MTU, packets may be retransmitted. A small MTU may result in a higher number of packets and cause overheads and performance limitations. The default MTU is 1500 bytes. Setting the MTU size sets the system MTU.
help_STP_mode: Your device supports MST, PVST, or RPVST STP mode on VLANs Spanning-Tree Protocol (STP) prevents loops when switches are interconnected via multiple paths. STP implements the IEEE 802.1D algorithm by exchanging BPDU messages with other switches to detect loops, and then removes the loop by shutting down selected bridge interfaces. This algorithm guarantees that there is only active path between two network devices. Your device supports MST, PVST, and RPVST STP modes.
help_STP_bridge_priority_number: Select a VLAN ID and update the bridge priority number. The bridge priority is a numerical value that is used with the MAC address, to find the switch on the network. The default value is 32768. The priority can only be configured in multiples of 4096.
help_HTTP_port: Enter the designated port to listen for HTTP requests. The default port is 80. Valid values are 80, and ports between 1024 and 65535
help_HTTPS_port: Enter the designated port to listen for HTTPS requests. The default port is 443. Valid values are 443, and ports between 1025 and 65535. On a secure HTTPS connection, data to and from an HTTP server is encrypted before being sent over the Internet. HTTP with SSL encryption provides a secure connection to allow you to connect to your device from a Web browser.
help_HTTPS_enable_trustpoint: Enable this to use Certificate Authority (CA) servers as trustpoints. CA servers provide centralized security key and certificate management for the participating devices. When a connection attempt is made, the HTTPS server provides a secure connection by issuing a certified X.509v3 certificate, obtained from a specified CA trustpoint, to the client. The client (usually a Web browser), in turn, has a public key that allows it to authenticate the certificate. For secure HTTP connections, we recommend that you configure a CA trustpoint.
help_HTTP_timeout: Enter the number of seconds of inactivity allowed before the session times out.
help_software_update_file_type: Specify if you want to update only the Web UI software or both the IOS and Web UI bundle, on your device.
help_software_update_select_file: Browse to the appropriate upgrade file on your computer. This is typically a file you downloaded from the software downloads available to you on http://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/index.html.
help_admin_username: Enter a username that is unique and between 1 and 25 characters long.
help_admin_privilege: The privilege level you associate with the user defines what commands they can enter using the CLI after they have logged into the device. Privilege 1 allows access in User Exec mode and privilege 15 allows access in Privileged Exec mode.
help_admin_password: Enter a password that is between 8 and 127 characters long. It is recommended that the password is a combination of at least three of the following categoriesâ€”lowercase letters, uppercase letters, digits, and special characters. The new password should not be the same as the associated username or any close variant of the username. The characters in the password should not be repeated more than three times consecutively. The password should not be cisco, ocsic, admin, nimda, or any variant of the order of letters, or by substituting '1' '|' or '!' for i, and/or substituting '0' for 'o', and/or substituting '$' for 's'.
help_admin_confirm_password: Enter the password again to confirm.
day0_wizard_welcome_text: WELCOME ! READ THE BELOW INSTRUCTIONS BEFORE YOU BEGIN
day0_wizard_ip_address_invalid_msg: Invalid IP Address or IP Address not provided for any of the selected interfaces.
cluster_add_fail: Failed to add member to cluster.
switch_fail_msg: Switch Data was failed to apply.
stp_fail_msg: STP Data was failed to apply.
day0_wizard_summary_text: This screen provides the summary of all the steps configured as part of day0 configuration in this wizard. Click Submit to configure the device or click on any of the links above to revisit and edit. Once you click submit, the wizard will no longer be accessible. For accessing the Web UI, you will need to launch it using the configured IP address. Ensure that the subnet in which the switch IP address is configured  is reachable.
dayzero_wizard_welcome_text: The day0 wizard will provide an interface to configure basic settings like IP address, hostname, username and password, data VLAN, access ports, default route and default gateway.  Keep all the required information handy before you launch the wizard.
dayzero_wizard_welcome_text_note: Please note that once the configuration is complete, the wizard will no longer be accessible. For accessing the Web UI, you will need to launch it using the configured IP address. Ensure that the subnet in which the switch IP address is configured  is reachable.
dayzero_wizard_basic_con_def_tip: Configure the basic information like the hostname, username and password, enable password and the time.
dayzero_wizard_inter_con_def_tip: Configure the interface information in this screen. Ensure the information provided here is correct as this will be used in Layer 3 configuration.
dayzero_wizard_layer_con_def_tip: Configure the IP Address, default gateway and default route if applicable in this screen. The interfaces configured in the previous step will be available for configuring them with an IP address.
dayzero_wizard_adv_con_def_tip: If you want to enable Telnet or SSH access to the switch, select the appropriate checkbox to configure.
saveconfig_success_msg: Configuration has been successfully persisted to memory.
saveconfig_fail_msg: The configuration could not be successfully persisted to memory. Ensure you have the correct privileges to perform this operation and that software update or another write operation is not in progress.
ntp_success_msg: NTP Sever Config Data was successfully applied.
ntp_fail_msg: NTP Sever Config Data was failed to applied.
confirm_save_config: Are you sure you want to save the configuration?
help_switch_coap: Select the check box to enable Constrained Application Protocol.  CoAP provides a request - response interaction model between application endpoints, and supports built-in discovery of services and resources.
help_port_config_eventclassification: Select the checkbox to allocate a power budget of  30W for the device. If 2-Event Classification  is not enabled, the power budget allocation is 15.4W.
help_port_config_poe: Select the checkbox to provide uninterrupted power to a powered device even when the switch is booting, and  eliminate the need for a backup power source.
stack_virtual_member_confirm: Enter enable secret to add switch to cluster
stack_success_msg: Stack Config Data was successfully applied.
help_stacking: Choose a  value to indicate if the the device is a standalone switch or is part of a physcial switch stack. Choose  Virtual Stacking to stack switches virtually  and manage them as a single logical entity.
help_stacking_selecon: Choose a  value to indicate if the the device is a standalone switch. Choose  Virtual Stacking switches virtually  and manage them as a single logical entity.
help_domain_name: Enter the domain in which the switch will form a virtual stack with other switches. All switches in a stack must be part of the same domain.
help_stacking_delete_member: Are you sure you want to remove the selected switch from the cluster?
help_stacking_standAlone_warning: Changing the stacking state to Standalone may be disruptive. Are you sure you want to continue?
trouble_shoot_unrecognized: Unrecognized host or address, or protocol not running
trouble_shoot_invalid_source: Invalid source interface - IP not enabled or interface is down
nf_success_msg: NetFlow Config Data was successfully applied.
help_netflow_Template: Choose a pre-defined template to determine what information to monitor in your network traffic.  You can choose to monitor application and server usage, network security vulnerabilites, network capacity and bandwidth usage.
help_collector_IP_Address: Enter the IP address of the designated device on which the exported Netflow data is collected.
help_switch_Export_Address: Choose the IP address to identify the switch interface  from which flows will be exported to the collector.
help_sampling_Method: Choose the method based on which traffic originating from the port  is monitored. Deterministic monitors the first packet in a specified number of packets. Random alows packets to be monitored randomly by the device. Full NetFlow monitors all the traffic  on the specified device port.
help_input_Capture_Interface: Choose the switch interface on which to apply NetFlow.
trouble_shoot_diagnostic_confirm: The Diagnostic tests chosen may disrupt the switch.Do you still want to run the tests?
help_trouble_shoot_diagnostic: Choose the kind of tests to run on the switch. Running diagnostic tests may be disruptive to the switch. The table below shows the results of the last run tests. To view the results of the newly run tests, please refresh the page.
help_trouble_shoot_ping_source: Choose the interface from which ping packets will be sent to the specified destination. Ping  helps troubleshoot connectivity problems, communication delays and packet loss.
help_trouble_shoot_ping_destination: Enter the destination IP address from which a reply is sent in response to the ICMP echo request that is sent by the ping source.
help_trouble_shoot_tracerouting_destinat: Enter the destination address for which you want to run traceroute. Traceroute helps discover the routes that packets take when traveling to their destination.
nf_interface_warning_msg: Interface is already associated with a sampler, please choose a different interface.
factory_reset_confirm: Are you sure you want to reset the switch to factory settings? This will erase all the configuration and reload the switch.
help_switch_Bluetooth: Toggle the button appropriately to turn Bluetooth On or Off on the switch
help_switch_connect_to_controller: Connect to Controller disables Bluetooth as the device is considered ready for IT domain control. The switch is prepared to be connected to the uplink network controller.
help_switch_Staging: By default, Staging is set to Offline. Staging determines the way in which you connect to the Configuration Setup wizard to perform initial device setup tasks. When you reset the switch to factory defaults, and Staging is set to Offline, the device uses Bluetooth to connect to the wizard. If Staging is to Network, Bluetooth is switched off and you can hold the Mode down for 3 seconds to enter configuration mode and  access the wizard.
help_switch_status: By default, the LEDs on your device are turned off to conserve energy. To set the LED status to On and indicate ports and device status, click the image. You can set the LEDs to stay on for a maximum of 1 day, 23 hours and 59 minutes. If you do not specify the duration, the LEDs remain on for 2 minutes before they are turned off again.
nf_msg_delete_confirmation: Are you sure you want to remove netflow monitoring on the following interfaces?
sampler_limit_msg: Cannot create more than four samplers
nf_exporter_warning_msg: Exporter is already exists, please choose a different exporter.
aaa_max_server_group_4_method_list: Maximum of four Server Groups in a Method List
aaa_max_server_group_3_method_list: Maximum of three Server Groups in a Method List
aaa_atl_ser_grp: Atleast one Server Group must be assigned to the Method List
aaa_rad_server_already_msg: Radius server already exist with this IP and Port
aaa_server_rad_confirm_secret: Confirm Shared Secret should match with Shared Secret field
aaa_tac_server_already_msg: Tacacs server already exist with this IP and Port
aaa_pwd_min_chart: Password should be minimum of 1 character
aaa_success_msg: AAA Config Data was successfully applied.
aaa_names_not_allowed: RADIUS, TACACS, LDAP names are not allowed
aaa_server_ldap_name_req: Please provide a LDAP Server name
aaa_server_ldap_addr_req: Please provide a valid Server address
aaa_server_ldap_bind_cfmpwd_msg: Confirm Bind Secret should match with Bind Password field
staticroute_delete_popup: Are you sure you want to delete these Static Routes
staticroute_success_msg: Static Routing Data was successfully applied.
help_static_route_prefix: The IP address for the destination network.
help_static_route_prefixmask: The subnet mask for the destination IP address.
help_static_route_metric: Assign a metric, between 1 and 255, to the static route. When multiple paths to the same destination are available, the device uses the route with the lowest metric and adds the preferred route into the routing table.
help_static_route_path: Choose Interface to specify the output interface in the Interface drop-down list and assign a next-hop IP address to the output interface.  Choose Next Hop IP, to specify a next-hop IP address for the static route and assign a next-hop IP address. Choose DHCP, to assign a static route IP address using a DHCP server.
help_static_route_interface: Choose the interface to be used for this route. The packets will be forwarded to this interface.
help_static_route_hopip: Enter the IP address of the next hop. The packets will be forwarded to this address.
config_file_transfer_help_tips: Choose to transfer the configuration file either from a known source To the Switch or From the Switch to a known destination.
config_file_protocol_help_tips: Choose either TFTP Server or a Local Hard Drive to indicate the location of the configuration file.
config_file_filename_help_tips: If you choose to either transfer a configuration file from the device via the local hard drive or a TFTP server, or to the switch via TFTP, type the name of the configuration file.
config_file_localfile_help_tips: If you choose to transfer a configuration file to the switch from the local hard drive, click Browse and navigate to the folder that contains the file.
config_file_ipaddress_help_tips: Enter the IP address of the TFTP server
switch_cli_help: This interface mimics the CLI on the switch. To execute a command on the device, type the command and press Control+Enter/Return key or click Run Command.  Keyboard shortcuts: Control+X clears the command and its output. Control+Y copies the cli output. Control+Shift+E saves the cli output into file. Control+M toggles between the Exec and Configure command modes.
switch_cli_hint: Control+X: Clear | Control+M: Switch Mode | Control+Return(↲): Execute Command | Control+Y: Copy | Control+Shift+E: Export | Shift+Up Arrow(↑)/Down Arrow(↓): Lookup History
sys_dhcp_name_req: Please provide a valid DHCP scope name
sys_dhcp_option_value_msg: Please provide a valid options value
sys_dhcp_delete_msg: Are you sure you want to delete these scopes?
sys_dhcp_success_msg: DHCP scope Config Data was successfully applied.
sys_dhcp_help_scope_name: Enter a name for the DHCP scope. Network segments that do not have a separate DHCP server can have built-in DHCP scopes that assign IP addresses and subnet masks to hosts connecting to the device.
sys_dhcp_help_dns_server: Enter the IP address of the optional DNS server(s). Each DNS server must be able to update a client’s DNS entry to match the IP address assigned by this DHCP scope.
sys_dhcp_help_netbios_server: Enter the IP address of the optional Microsoft NetBIOS name servers, such as a Microsoft Windows Internet Naming Service (WINS) server.
sys_dhcp_help_dhcp_options: Click Add to add DHCP options.  DHCP options carry parameters as tagged data stored within protocol messages exchanged between the DHCP server and its clients.
config_file_transfer_success_msg_manualr: Config copied successfully. Please reload the switch to start with the configuration copied
config_file_restart_config_checkboxmsg: Reload switch with the new configuration
config_file_transfer_success_msg_autosta: Config copied successfully. Switch will restart now
help_day0_enable_VTPTransparent: Enable transparent mode if you do not want the switch to participate in VTP. A VTP transparent switch does not advertise its VLAN configuration and does not synchronize its VLAN configuration based on received advertisements, but transparent switches do forward VTP advertisements that they receive out their trunk ports in VTP Version 2.
dhcp_excludeaddress_success_msg: DHCP Excluded Address Config Data was successfully applied.
help_port_group_number: Enter the port  group to which you want to add the selected ports. Portgroups bundle interfaces into a group to provide increased bandwidth and redundancy.
help_port_group_type: Choose the protocol you want to associate with the portgroup. To enable LACP and PAgP timeout,  set the Keepalive field to On.
help_ports_keepalive_mode: Enable keepalive to unconditionally turn on the portgroup type protocol selected above. Disable keepalive to turn on the portgroup type protocol only when a compatible device is detected.
help_portConfig_ipAddress: Enter a valid IP address to configure on this layer 3 interface.
help_portConfig_subnetMask: Enter a valid subnet mask for the IP address provided
day0_wizard_ip_req_msg: Atleast one of the interfaces should have an IP address configured.

factory_reset_success: Successfully reset the switch to factory defaults.

acl_space_name: Space and '?' not allowed in Host Name
aaa_help_serverradius_name: Name of the server for selected protocol
aaa_help_serverradius_address: Configure ipv4 Address for selected protocol server
aaa_help_serverradius_authport: UDP port for RADIUS accounting server (default is 1646)
aaa_help_serverradius_acctport: UDP port for RADIUS authentication server (default is 1645)
aaa_help_servertacacs_port: TCP port for selected protocol server (default is 49)
help_vtp_domain_name: Set the name of the VTP administrative domain
help_vtp_version: Set the administrative domain VTP version number
help_vtp_mode_vlan: Set the device to selected mode for VLAN
help_vtp_mode_mst: Set the device to selected mode for MST
ntp_delete_confirmation: Are you sure you want to delete the Selected NTP(S)?
help_dhcp_hostname: IP Address negotiated via DHCP. Specify value for DHCP hostname
help_dhcp_pool: IP Address autoconfigured from a local DHCP pool
acl_host_name256: Host Name should be within 256 characters
acl_help_type: Type of Access List such as IPV4 Standard, IPV4 Extended, IPV6
acl_help_action: Specify packets to reject or forward
acl_help_sourcetype: Type of source: IP-Address to match, Any-Any source host, Host-A single host address
acl_help_destinationType: Type of destination: IP-Address to match, Any-Any destination host, Host-A single host address
acl_help_SourcePort: Match source packets only on below options
acl_help_destinationPort: Match destination packets only on below options
acl_help_DSCP: Match packets with given dscp value
vtp_help_primary_vlan: Make this switch as primary for VLAN feature
vtp_help_primary_mst: Make this switch as primary for Mst feature
vtp_primary_help_force: Forcing this switch as primary and Do not check for conflicting devices
help_es_security: Set security parameters for this EnergyWise domain. NTP-Shared-Secret - Set the shared secret and use ntp clock to check sequence window . Shared-Secret - Set the shared secret for this EnergyWise domain
help_es_domain_pwd_msg: 0 - Specifies an UNENCRYPTED shared secret for the domain will follow , 7 - Specifies a HIDDEN shared secret for the domain will follow , WORD - Specify the shared secret for the EnergyWise domain (UNENCRYPTED)
help_es_portno_msg: Port number to use to communicate with the EnergyWise domain <1-65000>
help_es_int_msg: Specify an interface to use to communicate with the EnergyWise domain
help_es_ip_msg: Specify an ipaddress to use to communicate with the EnergyWise domain
wol_success_title: Successfully submitted the request to run WoL
poe_success_msg: Interface power level was successfully applied
bluetooth_success_msg: Bluetooth Config Data was successfully applied
stp_bludhcp_same_msg: Blutooth interface and DHCP Subnetmask should be same
svi_help_desc: Up to 200 characters describing this interface
svi_help_relay_info: Received DHCP packet may contain relay info option with zero giaddr
ipaddress_change_msg: Make sure the interface IP details provided are correct. Incorrect configuration will result in switch becoming unreachable.
svi_delete_confirmation: Are you sure you want to delete the Selected SVI(S)?

es_config_success_msg: EnergyWise Domain Config Data was successfully applied.
aaa_policy_help_servergrp: Use list of all selected server group hosts.

es_portno_range_msg: Port Number range should be 1 to 65000
diagnostic_success_final_msg: Diagnostic test executed successfully and displayed the latest Results
wifi_config_message: User is provided with the option to enable and configure Wifi.
ap_config_message: This enables the link to the device manager on the AP where further configuration can be done if required.
administrative_user_name_should_not_cont: Administrative User Name should not contain spaces or ?
administrative_password_shouldnot_contai: Administrative Password should not contain spaces or ?
psk_passphrase_should_not_contain_spaces: PSK Passphrase should not contain spaces or ?
dayzero_reentered_password_match_passwor: Re-entered password should match with password
dayzero_should_in_same_network: IP Address should be same network
rip_help_network_ipaddress: Enable routing on an IP network
rip_help_passive_interface: Suppress routing updates on an interface
rip_help_timers: Basic routing protocol update timers like Interval between updates for RIP(Update),Invalid,Holddown,Flush
rip_help_authkey: Enter authentication key-chain name for Authentication control
eigrp_help_routerid: Specify router id for this EIGRP process
eigrp_help_network: Enable routing on an IP network
eigrp_help_stub: Set address-family in stubbed mode.Set receive only neighbor, Do advertise redistributed routes, Do advertise static routes,Do advertise summary routes
span_help_source_direction: Type of source direction like rx(Monitor received traffic only),Both(Monitor received and transmitted traffic),tx (Monitor transmitted traffic only)
span_help_filter: Showing Span Filter type Ipv4 (Specify IP Access control rules), Ipv6 (Specify IPv6 Access control rule), Vlan (SPAN filter VLAN)
help_practices: Neighbour change,Neighbour warning,eigrp distance,Max Path,Event Log,Passive Interface,Hold Time,Hello Interval, Authentication Mode
day0help_wireless_same_credential: The user credentials entered for the switch will be applied to the wireless controller if this check box is selected
day0help_wireless_user_name: Create an admin username for accessing the Wireless controller. Username can be upto maximum 24 characters
wireless_password: The admin password must contain atleast 8 characters including Uppercase, Lower case , special characters and numeric values
day0help_wireless_system_name: Enter a name for the Wireless Controller. The System name can be upto 31 characters
day0help_wireless_country: Select the country from the dropdown list that matches the physical location of the Wireless controller and its accesspoints
day0help_wireless_management_ip_address: Enter an IP address & subnet for the Wireless Controller Management interface. The command line and web interface of the wireless controller can be accessed using the wireless management IP address
day0help_wireless_network_name: Enter a name for the Wireless Network (SSID) . The SSID is a unique identifier that wireless devices use to establish and maintain wireless connectivity. SSIDs are case sensitive and can contain up to 32 alphanumeric characters
day0help_wireless_security: Select a security type for the Wireless Network from the dropdown options. 1) WPA2 Personal - WPA2 personal is a security mechanism used to authenticate and validate users on a wireless LAN and provides good security using a Passphrase or Pre-Shared Key (PSK).2) WPA2 enterprise- WPA2 enterprise provides a higher level of security using EAP (802.1x) to authenticate/authorize network users with a remote RADIUS server
day0help_wireless_radius_server: Enter the IP address of the RADIUS server used for authentication
day0help_wireless_shared_key: Enter shared secret key used by RADIUS authentication server.The shared key can be upto 64 ASCII characters
day0help_wireless_auth_port: Enter the port number used by the RADIUS server for authentication
day0help_wireless_phassphrase: Enter PSK passphrase between 8-63 ASCII characters
day0help_enable_dhcp: Enable this option to create a DHCP pool that will be used by this interface. The DHCP pool will be created for the network address the interface belongs to. Clients that connect through this interface will be allocated IP addresses from this pool
day0help_wireless_vlan: Enter the VLAN id for wireless network. All access points that join will be under this domain. This configuration is necessary if you want the APs to join the controller which is connected to this switch
rip_network_address_gridrequired: Atleast one Network Address must be added into grid
rip_neighbour_address_gridrequired: Atleast one Neighbour Address must be added into grid
span_source_dest_filter_select: Atleast one source/destination interface or filter should be selected
span_rspan_success_msg: Span Config Data was successfully applied.
me_config_fail_details: Failed to configure ME wireless controller. This does not prevent the switch day0 Configuration. ME Error:
day0help_wireless_not_possible: The wireless controller cannot be configured because you have not configured the Wireless VLAN in the interfaces page!
wireless_ip_address_check: Wireless VLAN interface IP Address and Controller Mgmt IP Address should not be same
wireless_mgmt_ip_address_invalid: Wireless VLAN interface IP Address and Wireless Management IP address should be in the same subnet and unique within the range {0} and {1}
logs_tobe_displayed: Number of latest log entries to display
buffer_logsize_range: Buffer Logging Size range should be 4096 to 2147483647
exception_logsize_range: Exception Logging Size range should be 4096 to 2147483647
count_time_logg_help: Count every log message and timestamp last occurance
log_config_status_success: Log Configuration Data was Successfully applied
debug_help_name: Maximum 25 chracters are allowed. Valid Characters: a-z, A-Z, 0-9, - and _
debug_cli_list: Enter the CLIs of which output needs to be packaged. Maximum 5 CLIs are allowed.
debug_enter_cli: Enter the CLIs of which output needs to be packaged
debug_help_clilist: This supports user to create a package with required info like CLI outputs, logs etc for reporting and debugging the issues
switch_cli_help_sm: This interface mimics the CLI on the switch. To execute a command on the device, type the command and press Control+Enter/Return key or click Run Execute.  Keyboard shortcuts: Control+X clears the command and its output. Control+Y copies the cli output. Control+Shift+E saves the cli output into file.
switch_cli_hint_sm: Control+X: Clear | Control+Y: Copy | Control+Shift+E: Export | Shift+Up Arrow(↑)/Down Arrow(↓): Lookup History
confirm_renewcert_config: Are you sure you want to renew the certificate?
help_switch_Bluetooth_intstattus: Bluetooth interface is actually capable of doing any transfer
vtp_pruning_mode_help: Set the administrative domain to permit pruning
stp_forward_time_help: Set the forward delay for the spanning tree
stp_hello_time_help: Set the hello interval for the spanning tree
stp_maxage_time_help: Set the max age interval for the spanning tree
help_STPport_type: Enable portfast edge by default/network by default/normal on this switch
help_stp_loopguard: Enable loopguard by default on all ports
help_stp_transmit_holdcount: Set the txholdcount parameter for RSTP and MST
help_stp_bpdufilter: Enable portfast edge bpdu filter on this switch
help_stp_bpduguard: Enable portfast edge bpdu guard on this switch
help_static_route_path_ipv6: Choose Interface to specify the output interface in the Interface drop-down list and assign a next-hop IP address to the output interface.  Choose Next Hop IP, to specify a next-hop IP address for the static route and assign a next-hop IP address.
help_lacpsys_priority: LACP priority for the system, Priority value is 0-65535
help_lacpport_priority: LACP priority on this interface , Priority value is 0-65535
snmp_host_community: SNMPv1/v2c community string or SNMPv3 user name
port_help_loop_detection: Configure loopdetect feature setting . Default Time is 5 seconds between sending of loopdetect frames.Enabling this feature might put the port(s) of switch to err-disable if loopdetect frame is received on it.It is not recommended to enable this when STP is already enabled and on trunk ports as it is VLAN un-aware
port_help_arp: Enable ARP Inspection on an interface by configuring Trust state and configure Limit Rate of incoming ARP packets
port_arp_range: ARP Inspection Limit Rate range is 0-2048
igmp_snooping_help: Global IGMP Snooping enable for Catalyst VLANs
igmp_last_member_count_range: Last Member Query Count range is 1-7
igmp_member_interval_range: Last Member Query Interval range is 100-32767
igmp_snooping_help1: Global IGMP Snooping enable for Catalyst VLAN
igmp_mcast_learning_mode_help: Set the multicast router learning method
sys_dhcp_smart-relay_tool_tip: Allows the DHCP relay agent to switch the gateway address (giaddr field of a DHCP packet) to secondary addresses when there is no DHCPOFFER message from a DHCP Server.
sys_dhcp_noofping_packets_tool_tip: Specifies the number of ping packets the DHCP Server sends to a pool address before assigning the address to a requesting client. The default is two packets. Setting the count argument to a value of 0 turns off DHCP Server ping operation completely.
sys_dhcp_timeout_tool_tip: Specifies the amount of time the DHCP Server must wait before timing out a ping packet. The default is 500 milliseconds.
sys_dhcp_refrwding_tool_tip: Determines the relay information reforwarding policy in a cable modem termination system.
sys_dhcp_database_help_tips: Please enter any url with FTP, TFTP, rcp, http or https etc.
sys_dhcp_tooltip_clear_binding: Deletes an automatic address binding from the DHCP database. Specifying the address argument clears the automatic binding for a specific (client) IP address, whereas specifying an asterisk (*) clears all automatic bindings.
sys_dhcp_tooltip_clear_conflict: Clears an address conflict from the DHCP database. Specifying the address argument clears the conflict for a specific IP address, whereas specifying an asterisk (*) clears conflicts for all addresses.
sys_dhcp_tooltip_clear_server: Resets all DHCP Server counters to 0.
sys_dhcp_invalid_hexadecimal_number: Please provide a valid hexa Decimal number
help_rmon_mibObject: Enter the MIB object to monitor
help_rmon_interval: Sample interval with the range of 1-2147483647
help_rmon_test: Absolute -Test each sample directly . Delta -Test delta between samples
help_rmon_description: Specify a description of the event
help_rmon_log: Enable the Log to generate RMON log when the event fires
help_rmon_owner: Specify an owner for the alarm/event
help_aaa_serverGroup_name: AAA Server group definitions for Radius,Tacacs+,Ldap
help_aaa_configuration_retransmitInterva: Specify the number of retries to active server
help_aaa_configuration_timeoutInterval: Time to wait for a RADIUS server to reply
help_aaa_configuration_deadTime: Time to stop using a server that doesn't respond
help_port_config_mdix: Enable/Disable automatic Media Dependent Interface with Crossover detection on this interface
help_port_config_port_priority: Change an interfaces spanning tree port priority . Port priority in increments of 16
help_port_config_flow_control: Configure receiving flow operation. Desired-Allow but do not require flow-control packets on port , off/on-Disable/Enable flow-control packets on port
hstack_switch_priority_help: Set the priority of the specified switch
port_config_stp_entension_help: Enable portfast edge/network on the interface or Disable portfast for this interface
port_config_loopguard_help: Set guard mode to loop guard on interface
management_snmp_community_invalid_access: Access value should be in between 1-99 or 1300-1999
